reviews.review_msg: He cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He goes beyond the typical teaching roles of a professor and tries to make real, personal connections with all of his students. What I liked the most from his class is that he encouraged us to be creative. As someone who dislikes formal essay writing, I enjoyed doing the assignments.

Levy is a great prof. To those who posted below-Welcome to University...maybe you should take more than one English class before you start slandering good profs. Lectures were fun and engaging. Assignments were clear and fairly marked. Michelle has a genuine interest in teaching and in her students.
Although Colleen is articulate, helpful and passionate about her subject, she is a very picky marker, not so much on ideas, but grammar and punctuation--also plays favorites.
Colette is such a helpful person, and a wonderful prof. Her intelligence shines through with her lectures, but she's super modest. The field trips are fun too :)
Hands down, best Engl prof. at SFU to date.

Great professor. Her lectures are very well organized and the seminars are filled with fun and engaging activities. She genuinely cares about students and wants everyone to do their best. I would take her class again.
Colette is great!  Her lectures are usually great- every day is a slideshow!  And she always has fun activities, not bad ones.  A great class!
She seems to be very busy...thus, she can be disorganized and too busy to notice you. Picky marker, likes to lecture.  Not the best but not the worst~ c'est la vie
She is great and really knows her stuff which.  Very interested in content!
